results.title: In Loving Memory. Alice
results.creator_credit: Michael Riley, Pamela Williams, Ron Saunders and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Breakthrough series”.
In Loving Memory - we meet Mary who develops cancer in primary school, and see the effects that the illness and treatment have on her life. Mary examines her relationship with family and friends and the value she puts on life. In “Alice” we meet an Aboriginal teenager who is subjected to racism, both at school and in the community. The effects of prejudice are seen as we eavesdrop on her thoughts and watch her achieve her ambitions despite the attacks on her self confidence.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Riley, Pamela Williams, Ron Saunders and Film Australia

results.title: Dad's Girl/Common Ground
results.creator_credit: Martin Daley, Judy Menczel, Pamela Williams and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Breakthrough series”.
In “Dad’s Girl” we meet Janea who lives with her mother and still misses her father years after the divorce. She discusses the effect of her parents’ divorce on her life. In “Common Ground”, Sean’s experience of his parents’ divorce and his new step-father are shown along with the changes he makes to adapt to his new family situation.

results.title: The Stress Factor/ a Crime Called Violence
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Breakthrough series”.
In “The Stress Factor” Andrew Denton and his teenage laboratory technicians identify and examine stress, its causes and effects along with methods of dealing with it. Andrew Denton and a panel of teenagers discuss the perpetrators and victims in “A Crime Called Violence”. Methods of coping with violence inflicted by peers and the reason behind their aggression are discussed by the group from their first hand experiences.

results.title: More Winners Series
results.brief_description: A second series of highly acclaimed television programs for children. ‘Winners’ and ‘More Winners’ are anthology series of fourteen telemovies, featuring historical drama, comedy, science fiction, fantasy, adventure and social realism. Each film celebrates individuality and the facing of difficult situations with courage and ingenuity.

results.title: More Winners : The Journey
results.creator_credit: Jane Oehr, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Richard Mason
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘More Winners’.
Justus Zukermann, a wealthy prospector, lives with his 12 year old daughter, Ada on a windswept mountain plateau. Since Ada’s mother died, Martha and her step-daughter, Agnes, have been employed to run the household. One day Justus is fatally injured in a fall. Before he dies he orders Ada to journey south to find her true inheritance. Agnes is to accompany her. Martha (who is in fact a witch) has for years envied Justus’ wealth. She determines to secure the hidden fortune for herself and orders Agnes to kill Ada and steal the map once they reach the forest. Agnes is unable to kill Ada and the two girls are drawn together. After several adventures the girls find a secret cave, unearth the buried treasure and a letter from Justus, which makes the purpose of their journey very clear. Rated: G

results.title: More Winners : The Journey (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jane Oehr, Richard Mason and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘More Winners’.
Twelve year old Ada lives with her father on top of a mountain, looked after by Martha, the housekeeper, and Martha’s daughter Agnes. On his death- bed, Ada’s father tells her to journey south to seek her true inheritance. But Martha, who is a witch, is determined to get the inheritance first. She orders Agnes to follow Ada, kill her and steal her map. But Agnes is unable to kill her friend and the two are drawn together on a journey for buried treasure.

results.title: More Winners : The Big Wish
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘More Winners’.
In the Enchanted Realm the Faeries are in trouble. According to the Charters of the Grand Masters, they must give away seven wishes to the humans every 100 years or they will lose their magic powers. The last wish was given away 99 years and 364 days before. Prince Wilton is sent to earth to dispose of the 7 wishes to a sceptical and disbelieving human and before sundown. The only human being who will believe in him and make any wish is Christopher Walter Pratt (C W). C W doesn’t realise, however, that the last wish lasts forever. The lessons C W has taught and learnt leave their mark on him and those he meets on his journey through a truly magical day.

results.title: More Winners : Second Childhood
results.creator_credit: Mario Andreacchio, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Jane Ballantyne
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘More Winners”.
At school, Mark meets Annie who believes she is the reincarnation of Australia’s most famous racehorse - Phar Lap. Mark is fascinated by the concept of being someone else and becomes convinced he is the reincarnation of Henry Ford. His friends at school also get into the act believing they were Queen Victoria and Albert Einstein. At first they revel in their new identities especially when a major new school assignment is to research the life of a prominent historical figure. When their research reveals that their past lives were collectively responsible for quite a few of the world’s current problems, the children set out on a daring mission to make up for what they have done. Rated: G

results.title: More Winners : Second Childhood (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Mario Andreacchio, Jane Ballantyne and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘More Winners’.
At school Mark meets Annie who believes she is the re-incarnation of Phar Lap. Soon Mark becomes fascinated by reincarnation and discovers he was Henry Ford in a past life. His friends also get into the act, and soon they are all revelling in their new “old” identities. But when they work out that in their past lives they were responsible for some of the world’s current problems, they set out on a mission to make up for what they’ve done.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mario Andreacchio, Jane Ballantyne and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

At school Mark meets Annie who believes she is the re-incarnation of Phar Lap. Soon Mark becomes fascinated by reincarnation and discovers he was Henry Ford in a past life. His friends also get into the act, and soon they are all revelling in their new “old” identities. But when they work out that in their past lives they were responsible for some of the world’s current problems, they set out on a mission to make up for what they’ve done.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series ‘More Winners’.
At school Mark meets Annie who believes she is the re-incarnation of Phar Lap. Soon Mark becomes fascinated by reincarnation and discovers he was Henry Ford in a past life. His friends also get into the act, and soon they are all revelling in their new “old” identities. But when they work out that in their past lives they were responsible for some of the world’s current problems, they set out on a mission to make up for what they’ve done.
